greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of elements in the symmetric group S_n whose distance from a fixed element is the group diameter under compositions of (1,2) and (1,2,...,n).
comment: a(n) is the number of elements in the symmetric group S_n that are maximally distant from any fixed element, where distance is taken to be the minimal sequence of operations composed from transposition (1,2) and rotation (1,2,...,n) producing one element from another.  This maximal distance is the diameter of S_n under the stated compositions, given by A039745(n).

Conjecture (verified up to n = 13): Consider the a(n) permutations that take A039745(n) steps to reach the identity. For odd n>5, we have a(n) = 2 and the actions of these permutations on the list [1, 2, ..., n] are
and for even n>5, we have a(n) = 1 and the action of the permutation is
formula: Conjecture: For n>4, a(n) = 1 if n is even, a(n) = 2 if n is odd. - _Ben Whitmore_, Nov 14 2020
results.author: _Tony Bartoletti_, Feb 23 2011
